body_html:
@cpuhrsch, can you please elaborate what I should do with taskset? do you want me to bind the process to a particular core?

As for numbers, here is a sample:

Here is a sample 1 thread run

OMP_NUM_THREADS=1 python convnet_benchmarks.py --batch_size 20 --model AlexNet --iterations 10 --warmup_iterations 1 --cpu --num_workers 8
...
Main run finished. Milliseconds per iter: 4081.29. Iters per second: 0.24502

and a 16 thread run

OMP_NUM_THREADS=16 python convnet_benchmarks.py --batch_size 20 --model AlexNet --iterations 10 --warmup_iterations 1 --cpu --num_workers 8
...
Main run finished. Milliseconds per iter: 9657.06. Iters per second: 0.103551

body:
@cpuhrsch, can you please elaborate what I should do with taskset? do you want me to bind the process to a particular core?

As for numbers, here is a sample:

Here is a sample 1 thread run
```
OMP_NUM_THREADS=1 python convnet_benchmarks.py --batch_size 20 --model AlexNet --iterations 10 --warmup_iterations 1 --cpu --num_workers 8
...
Main run finished. Milliseconds per iter: 4081.29. Iters per second: 0.24502
```
and a 16 thread run
```
OMP_NUM_THREADS=16 python convnet_benchmarks.py --batch_size 20 --model AlexNet --iterations 10 --warmup_iterations 1 --cpu --num_workers 8
...
Main run finished. Milliseconds per iter: 9657.06. Iters per second: 0.103551
```
